Intervention.evidence: systemic–pulmonary artery shunt versus right ventricle–pulmonary artery conduit

Objective.evidence: Objective: The purpose of this analysis was to evaluate a novel strategy for reporting adverse events

Method_Outcome.evidence: The analysis encompassed the period from randomization (Norwood surgery) to hospital discharge from stage II surgery.

Result_Outcome.evidence: the rate of serious adverse events requiring expedited reporting decreased as expected (0.42 vs 0.14/subject/month of follow-up; P < .001)

Harms.evidence: Subjects with a serious (sentinel) adverse event in period 2 had a significantly higher rate of death and cardiac transplantation.
